mil.nga.giat.geowave.store.data.visibility

Interface VisibilityManagement<T>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ColumnVisibilityManagement, JsonDefinitionColumnVisibilityManagement

    public interface VisibilityManagement<T>
    Provides a single consolidated tool to (1) determine the visibility for a specific field. (2) provide VisibilityTransformationIterator to transform visibilities. A subclass of the ColumnVisibilityManagement provides transforming functions for visibilities defined in terms of Accumulo Column Visibility, without any alternate interpretive adaptors. Thus, visibility is defined in terms of an expression (e.g. a&b|c). However, Accumulo users may wish to define an alternate interpreter for visibility along with an alternate format. In this case, the transformation would need to be redefined by a different implementation.

    • Method Detail

      • translateVisibility

        byte[] translateVisibility(Object visibilityObject,
                           String fieldName)
        Parameters:
        visibilityObject - an object that defines visibility for each field
        fieldName - the field to which visibility is being requested
        Returns:
        null if the default should be used, otherwise return the visibility for the provide field given the instructions found in the visibilityObject

      • createVisibilityWriter

        FieldLevelVisibilityWriter<T,Object> createVisibilityWriter(String fieldName,
                                                            FieldWriter<T,Object> writer,
                                                            FieldVisibilityHandler<T,Object> defaultFieldVisiblityHandler,
                                                            String visibilityAttribute)
        Create a wrapper visibility writer. In most cases, the return value should be FieldLevelVisibilityWriter using the FieldVisibilityHandler created by createVisibilityHandler(String, FieldVisibilityHandler, String) The motivation to provide an alternate implementation is to support a strategy where each field carries its own marking. In such a case, the method {@link VisibilityManagement#translateVisibility(Object, String) would not be used since

      • createVisibilityHandler

        FieldVisibilityHandler<T,Object> createVisibilityHandler(String fieldName,
                                                         FieldVisibilityHandler<T,Object> defaultHandler,
                                                         String visibilityAttributeName)
        Create a visibility handler
        Parameters:
        fieldName - -- the name of the field for object of type T requiring visibility treatment
        defaultHandler - -- default handler if the visibilityAttributeName is not provided or the field does not exist in a provided object of type T.
        visibilityAttributeName - -- optional name of a field that determines visibility of each field in an object of type T
        Returns:
